title: Assistant Vice President, Business Process Management (BPM) Technology Lead
description: Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group, Inc. (MUFG) is one of the world‚Äôs leading financial groups. Headquartered in Tokyo and with over 360 years of history, MUFG has a global network with over 2,700 locations in more than 50 markets. The Group has over 180,000 employees and offers services including commercial banking, trust banking, securities, credit cards, consumer finance, asset management, and leasing.The Group aims to ‚Äúbe the world‚Äôs most trusted financial group‚Äù through close collaboration among our operating companies and flexibly respond to all of the financial needs of our customers, serving society, and fostering shared and sustainable growth for a better world. MUFG‚Äôs shares trade on the Tokyo, Nagoya, and New York stock exchanges.MUFG Bank, Ltd. is Japan‚Äôs premier bank, with a global network spanning more than 50 markets. Outside of Japan, the bank offers an extensive scope of commercial and investment banking products and services to businesses, governments and individuals worldwide.For more information, visit https://www.mufg.jp/english.Job Scope / DescriptionWe are seeking highly motivated candidates for the position of Business Process Management (BPM) Technology Lead within Information Technology Department under Systems Office for Asia.This individual will be a key member of the team who will be responsible for formulating solutions to business  technical requirements, and architecting solutions based on the delivery schedule. He/she will lead the team to design blueprint which serves as baseline of project delivery and continual systems maintainability, guiding the team through the implementation (from design to deployment), and defining the specific solution, business, functional and non-functional requirements.  Understanding the business operating and IT solution strategy, identifying necessary IT capabilities to support business opportunities and technology implementation  Defining the solution processes  business and functional requirements, undertaking POC needed to validate the feasibility and realize the implementation  Working with other technical experts to explore and define how the systems interface/integration can be seamlessly achieved and fit into the overall solution architecture  Reviewing deliverables within the scope of the initiatives  Working closely with the business architect and IT partner to verify that the outcomes and detailed requirements are aligned  Familiar with the evolvement of BPM technologies (such as PEGA) and functionalities which should be adopted as out-of-the-box, advising users in the proper use of BPM features and options  Responsible for the Enterprise Class Structure and the overall application design, providing clear guidance on development best-practices, performing regular code and design reviews, coaching project team members  Taking commitment to continuously improve the BPM Platform. Conduct analysis of systems logs/alert effectively, provide timely resolution of incidents and mitigation of potential risks/tuning opportunities, execute counter measure as well as improvement plans  Making plan and taking charge of activities for better productivities and efficiencies including DevOps implementation, execution of automation in testing and deployments  Any other tasks or initiatives as deemed important to the operating of BPM Platform and the applications hosted on the platformJob Requirement  Minimum 10 years of IT working experience in end-to-end SDLC cycle from requirement gathering, analysis, design, testing and implementation  At least 5-7 years of hands-on experience in architecting and designing BPM solutions (e.g. PEGA) using PEGA Systems' PEGA Rules Process Commander (PRPC 7.x and newer versions)  Knowledge and experience in Banking domain.  Post-project support experience to identify and continue to enhance systems performance and values is essential  Experiences in Agile approach for implementation is added advantage.  Developed and demonstrated an advanced hands-on knowledge of the PRPC Architecture and all PRPC design and implementation features  Certified in PEGA Senior System Architect (SSA) / Certified Lead System Architect (CLSA)  Strong in communication verbally and in writing  Self-motivated and possess drive, and ability to work independently and a good team playerWe regret to inform that only shortlisted applicants will be notified Job ID:  10048363-WDRecruiter Name: Natalie Tan EA License No: 12C5536 EA Registration No: R1106672

title: Credit Associate
description: Position Description  ResponsibilitiesWe are now seeking for an Associate with the Credit team, based in Singapore. title: Assistant Manager, Learning Technology and Systems
description: About UsSingapore University of Social Sciences (SUSS) is a university with a rich heritage in inspiring lifelong education, and transforming society through social sciences. As one of Singapore's six autonomous universities, we champion inclusivity, bringing education to all regardless of age, qualification, experience and background; ensuring that lifelong learners are given equal opportunities to develop to their fullest potential.The Institute for Adult Learning (IAL), as part of SUSS, leads in the field of research on adult learning to build capabilities of the training and adult education (TAE) sector in Singapore and beyond.Grounded in our core philosophy of Head, Heart, Habit (3H), we take pride in our people‚Äôs success by provide them with a fulfilling career through purposely work that make a difference in our graduates journey, and investing in their professional development to bringing out the best in them.About RoleWe invite applications from committed professionals to join the Learning Technology and Systems team of IAL and enhance the quality of administration by providing reliable support solutions. The successful candidate will support and implement Institute for Adult Learning's efforts to manage the design, development and implementation of an application platform to support (i) the building capability and career development of Training and Adult Education (TAE) practitioners and (ii) provide the system to support the business processes for One-Stop Skills Credentialing and Adult Education Network.Your primary areas of responsibilities‚ÄØinclude:  Manage the design and development project to support the end-to-end business processes for One-Stop Skills Credentialing and Adult Education Network, Adult Educators' Professionalisation, TAE professional profiling and Jobs-skills insights. TAELENT is a talent platform to be used by Adult Educators in Singapore to profile their skills, look for jobs and assignments, look for suitable upskilling programmes and opportunities, interact with the adult educator community, and get recognition from IAL and SkillsFuture Singapore.  Manage the translation of  TAELENT business and user requirements into technical specifications for the development of the system.  Establish a system to provide good user experience to drive up number of active users of the platform.  Establish intuitive system function to support digital badging process to drive the issuance and adoption of skills badges.  Develop data dashboard and perform data analysis for TAE skills and job demand/supply.  Establish an eco-system to support TAE professionals in seeking job opportunities and projects through the TAELENT Platform.  Manage project budget and payment to system vendor for development and maintenance.  Manage the integration of  TAELENT platform to other systems, to ensure all milestones and tasks are well-planned and coordinated, supporting organisation IT masterplan.  Support any other corporate events or projects that may require assistance from time to time.Job Requirements:  Tertiary qualification in Information Technology, Computer Science, or Computer Engineering  preferably with at least 5-8 years of relevant business analyst working experience for full design/development and implementation/maintenance of enterprise-level system  Familiarity with the training and adult education sector is preferred.  Strong technical knowledge in application development (with full SDLC methodologies such as Waterfall, Agile, SCRUM etc.), programming languages (.NET, ASP.NET, Java, J2EE, Spring, HTML5, JS, CSS) and Cloud services (Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services or other cloud service providers) with experience in the operation of cloud architecture and related.  Formal training and qualifications in these technical areas is preferred.  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to manage all stakeholders at all levels for project discussions, updates and recommendations.  Proven project, resource and change management skills to handle the work demands and deliver high quality work within the given timelines.  Strong acumen in problem solving, critical thinking, logical/analytical, and process improvement  skills.  High learning agility, be able to work under time pressure, and be highly adaptable to thrive in a fast-paced, fast-changing environment.  An entrepreneurial spirit to do things better, be open to possibilities, and be able to navigate technical, political, and organisational roadblocks that can emerge.

title: Associate Creative Director/ Creative Director - Copy
description: Scope of workYou will lead the work on some of the most popular consumer brands in the world, impacting the daily lives of nearly 2 billion people in the fastest growing region in the world. You will work for clients who not only care about success in the marketplace, but are passionate about the role of brands in helping bring about social change.Expectations of an Associate Creative Director  Help lead and inspire creative teams to develop innovative design solutions, from broad concept development through implementation  Ideate, write and execute original and iconic creative concepts in response to client briefs, objectives or goals  Is responsible for the proper placement, context and meaning of every image and graphic element within a creative assignment  Extend client relationships and explore new ways to deliver value  Develop creative ideas that meets both our clients‚Äô objectives as well as our business objectives, maintaining the company‚Äôs expected levels of creative excellence and professionalism  Present, share and review creative work with Executive Creative Director/s, Account Management and Planning Leads as well as members of the Management Team  Manage multiple projects from concept through to completion, working with both in-house resources and third-party vendors  Collaborate effectively with Account Management, Planning and the broader creative team to develop disruptive and iconic work  Manage multiple projects from concept through to completion, working with both in-house resources and third-party vendors  Participants in, and leads brainstorming sessions  You will report into a Creative Director-level and aboveExpectations as a member of our community  You believe passionately in the power of creativity to bring change to the world. But you‚Äôre realistic and have a clear-eyed view of what it will take to get there: not a path you walk alone, but with a group of people putting a diverse range of skills and perspectives to work, towards a common goal  Your ideas and your voice will be heard, respected and protected with passion. Ideas are not disposable commodities here, they are our most precious assets  You will be tested, you will be challenged and you will be pushed beyond your comfort zone, but you will equally be supported, encouraged and celebrated. Because the true value of a community is that we bring out the best in each otherExpectations as a team leaderYou will learn that we prefer not to hire our leaders, but to grow them. As your own leadership journey evolves, your primary goal will be to nurture the next generation of leaders. You will reflect our ‚ÄúPeople First‚Äù ethos, where we believe that the best work can only come from a team that feels happy, secure and motivated, with a clarity of purpose. You understand that humility and kindness are equal in importance to daring and initiative. You value diversity, equality and inclusivity, not because it‚Äôs fashionable but because it‚Äôs obvious.In your role, you will specifically be expected to:  Provide leadership and professional development to department staff.  Mentor and train team members, write performance reviews, and allocate work  Monitor teams to deliver beyond client‚Äôs expectations  Motivate your team, and be the glue that keeps teams going  Set goals and KPIs for each team member, and works with them to achieve theseQualificationsYou have about 8 + years of work experience and a book brimming with brave ideas that have made an impact, big or small, on the world we live in  You‚Äôre a keen student of life, open and curious, always learning  As a communicator, every surface, every channel, every medium, social or otherwise, is your canvas. You‚Äôre just where people are  You‚Äôve won a few of the awards that matter. Winning isn‚Äôt everything, but excellence is  Strong grasp of social media space and online media jargon and technology  Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines in a fast-paced creative environment  Ability to effectively and appropriately interact with co-workers at a variety of levels, across many disciplines  Understands and uses the latest in computer design software  After hours work and overnight traveling to shoots and post sessions required  Naturally well organised and unfazed when working towards deadlines

title: Classroom Teacher
description: The school is looking to appoint a well- qualified, energetic EYFS Classroom Teacher for a January 2021 start (or later, for the right applicant).  Be responsible for the teaching of a class of pupils aged from eighteen months or up-to five years of age. At this stage, there is flexibility in the allocation of a particular year group.  Ensure medium-term and short-term plans are undertaken in accordance with the school policy.  Ensure that the parent portal is kept up-to-date and provides useful links for parents.  Work closely with parallel teacher(s) (where applicable) and teacher assistants regarding termly and weekly planning, and with other staff to ensure continuity and progression.  Ensure that the range of abilities among children is catered for by planned differentiated activities.  Ensure monitoring, recording, assessment and reporting are undertaken in accordance with the school policies.  Mark work, where applicable, appropriately and as immediately as possible in accordance with the marking policy, giving individual feedback and encouragement whenever possible.  In liaison with music teacher, be responsible for rehearsing and directing children for concerts and services.  Be responsible for the pastoral care of the children in the class and ensuring good personal relationships are fostered between the children themselves and with the teacher.  Be responsible for the behaviour and discipline of children in the class in accordance with the school behaviour policy.  Lunch daily with the children and monitor lunchtime behaviour (c/f staff handbook for procedure).  Liaise closely with the Head Master and other staff members regarding any children for concern.  Ensure that the classroom provides a stimulating and interesting learning environment. Displays should be changed regularly and be relevant to or the result of normal classroom work (c/f presentation policy).  Be responsible for the organisation of all classroom resources ensuring they are accessible to children as appropriate.  Ensure a range of appropriate reading books is available in the classroom.  Ensure home/school reading diaries are read daily by class teacher and comments made as appropriate to ensure good communication.  Ensure all paperwork is up-to-date and accurate (registers, profiles, health matters, etc.)  Meet with parents as required and foster good professional relationships and communication with parents.  Be prepared to market the school by speaking to prospective parents visiting the classroom, attending open evenings and acting as ambassadors for the school.  Attend parents' evenings and school functions as required.  Be responsible for care, security, and maintenance of resources and equipment in own classroom and throughout the school.  Undertake all duties and procedures as specified in staff handbook.  Organise a termly class assembly and occasionally lead whole school assemblies.  Attend Parent Association events and other evening/weekend events.  Attend staff/curriculum meetings including occasional whole school meetings.  Participate in the appraisal process.  Be prepared to attend INSETS (sometimes in evenings) and undertake continuous professional development.  Be responsible for taking an after-school activity club in liaison with CCA coordinator.  To be a good role model in respect of speech, dress, behaviour and care of equipment.

title: Associate Creative Director/ Creative Director - Copy
description: Scope of workYou will lead the work on some of the most popular consumer brands in the world, impacting the daily lives of nearly 2 billion people in the fastest growing region in the world. You will work for clients who not only care about success in the marketplace, but are passionate about the role of brands in helping bring about social change.Expectations of an Associate Creative Director  Help lead and inspire creative teams to develop innovative design solutions, from broad concept development through implementation  Ideate, write and execute original and iconic creative concepts in response to client briefs, objectives or goals  Is responsible for the proper placement, context and meaning of every image and graphic element within a creative assignment  Extend client relationships and explore new ways to deliver value  Develop creative ideas that meets both our clients‚Äô objectives as well as our business objectives, maintaining the company‚Äôs expected levels of creative excellence and professionalism  Present, share and review creative work with Executive Creative Director/s, Account Management and Planning Leads as well as members of the Management Team  Manage multiple projects from concept through to completion, working with both in-house resources and third-party vendors  Collaborate effectively with Account Management, Planning and the broader creative team to develop disruptive and iconic work  Manage multiple projects from concept through to completion, working with both in-house resources and third-party vendors  Participants in, and leads brainstorming sessions  You will report into a Creative Director-level and aboveExpectations as a member of our community  You believe passionately in the power of creativity to bring change to the world. But you‚Äôre realistic and have a clear-eyed view of what it will take to get there: not a path you walk alone, but with a group of people putting a diverse range of skills and perspectives to work, towards a common goal  Your ideas and your voice will be heard, respected and protected with passion. Ideas are not disposable commodities here, they are our most precious assets  You will be tested, you will be challenged and you will be pushed beyond your comfort zone, but you will equally be supported, encouraged and celebrated. Because the true value of a community is that we bring out the best in each otherExpectations as a team leaderYou will learn that we prefer not to hire our leaders, but to grow them. As your own leadership journey evolves, your primary goal will be to nurture the next generation of leaders. You will reflect our ‚ÄúPeople First‚Äù ethos, where we believe that the best work can only come from a team that feels happy, secure and motivated, with a clarity of purpose. You understand that humility and kindness are equal in importance to daring and initiative. You value diversity, equality and inclusivity, not because it‚Äôs fashionable but because it‚Äôs obvious.In your role, you will specifically be expected to:  Provide leadership and professional development to department staff.  Mentor and train team members, write performance reviews, and allocate work  Monitor teams to deliver beyond client‚Äôs expectations  Motivate your team, and be the glue that keeps teams going  Set goals and KPIs for each team member, and works with them to achieve theseQualificationsYou have about 8 + years of work experience and a book brimming with brave ideas that have made an impact, big or small, on the world we live in  You‚Äôre a keen student of life, open and curious, always learning  As a communicator, every surface, every channel, every medium, social or otherwise, is your canvas. You‚Äôre just where people are  You‚Äôve won a few of the awards that matter. Winning isn‚Äôt everything, but excellence is  Strong grasp of social media space and online media jargon and technology  Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines in a fast-paced creative environment  Ability to effectively and appropriately interact with co-workers at a variety of levels, across many disciplines  Understands and uses the latest in computer design software  After hours work and overnight traveling to shoots and post sessions required  Naturally well organised and unfazed when working towards deadlines

title: CWM, Private Wealth Management, Private Wealth Advisor, Executive Director (47887)
description: Consumer and Wealth Management (CWM)Across Consumer and Wealth Management (CWM), Goldman Sachs helps empower clients and customers around the world reach their financial goals. Our advisor-led wealth management businesses provide financial planning, investment management, banking and comprehensive advice to a wide range of clients, including ultra-high net worth and high net worth individuals, as well as family offices, foundations and endowments, and corporations and their employees. Our consumer business provides digital solutions for consumers to better spend, borrow, invest, and save. Across CWM, our growth is driven by a relentless focus on our people, our clients and leading-edge technology, data and design.PWMGoldman Sachs Private Wealth Management (PWM) specializes in creating comprehensive wealth management plans for high net worth individuals and families, as well as select institutions, including foundations and endowments. PWM Teams work one-on-one with clients to advise and deliver customized strategies drawn from our deep investment experience, diverse wealth management capabilities and global reach. Our Private Wealth Advisors (PWAs) deliver an unparalleled investment platform inclusive of the full product and service offerings of Goldman Sachs and beyond, which may include tax and estate planning, philanthropic planning and private banking and lending services. As client needs evolve, this close relationship allows the team to offer complementary services and new opportunities by leveraging the resources of Goldman Sachs and beyond.Private Wealth Advisors (PWAs) serve as trusted advisors to their clients, including wealthy individuals and families, corporate executives, entrepreneurs, and select institutions, including foundations and endowments. PWAs not only deliver a high level of service and an unparalleled investment platform, but also serve as their clients' bridge to the full product and service offerings of Goldman Sachs and beyond, which may include tax and estate planning, philanthropic planning, and private banking services.    PWAs and their teams offer specialized support and advice tailored to meet the specific needs and goals of each client.  This investment advice is based on analytic rigor, taking into account a client‚Äôs investment objectives, liquidity needs, and risk tolerance.     As a Private Wealth Advisor (PWA), you will develop new business opportunities, and support existing client relationships.Basic Qualification‚Ä¢ Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to build and foster a strong network of relationships‚Ä¢ Demonstrated interest in and knowledge of financial, economic and global capital markets‚Ä¢ Possess knowledge of investment products and be able to execute trades for equities, derivatives, fixed income, bonds, warrants and mutual funds‚Ä¢ Strong client focus, business development and relationship management skills‚Ä¢ Fluent in Mandarin and English due to client coverage, this role involves interaction with Mandarin speaking clients‚Ä¢ Proven leadership ability‚Ä¢ Strong analytical and communication (oral and written) skills‚Ä¢ Creative approach to problem solving and developing innovative solutions for clients‚Ä¢ Commitment to excellence and a high level integrity‚Ä¢ Prior sales, marketing or investing experience a plus, but not required‚Ä¢ Graduated with a university degreeABOUT GOLDMAN SACHSAt Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world. We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers. We‚Äôre committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html¬© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2020. All rights reserved.Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

title: Senior Software Developer, Accelerate Solutions
description: The opportunityWe are Accelerate Solutions, an innovative team building custom software for a wide range of clients! Our professional services team works across multiple platforms incorporating groundbreaking technologies like XR, robotics, machine learning and IoT. We work on a diverse range of business verticals including games, automotive, retail, manufacturing and entertainment.Are you interested in applying your technical skillset across different industries for global companies? You'll solve difficult problems and implement core features, playing a meaningful role in building and delivering high quality projects. You‚Äôre an experienced software developer that owns your work and maintains a passion to learn and grow. Our cross-disciplinary teams consist of world class developers, technical artists, 3D artists, UX  UI designers, and staff dedicated to software quality. Our goal is to inspire customers and transform industries!We're committed to maintaining a diverse team, and we welcome and encourage applicants with diverse experiences and backgrounds.What you‚Äôll be doing  Working with a software development team lead and a project team of designers, project managers and quality analysts to develop outstanding experiences  Working with the creative team to realize a design concept into implementation  Participating in code reviews to ensure only high quality software is committed  Following agile software development methodologiesWhat we‚Äôre looking forProven track record of delivering products with Unity and C#  Strong understanding of all aspects of the software development lifecycle  Good communicator with the ability to work as part of a team of diverse skillsets  Experience with AR/VR, mobile apps, desktop applications or games  Ability to find creative solutions to difficult problems  Proficiency in spoken and written EnglishYou might also have  Experience with cloud development, IoT, simulation, or machine learning  Experience integrating new software development with existing Enterprise systems  Experience leading small project teamsLife at UnityUnity (NYSE: U) is the world‚Äôs leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity‚Äôs platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.The company‚Äôs 1,800+ person research and development team keeps Unity at the forefront of development by working alongside partners to ensure optimized support for the latest releases and platforms. Apps developed by Unity creators were downloaded more than five billion times per month in 2020. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, disability, gender, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunters and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

title: Associate Creative Director/ Creative Director - Copy
description: Scope of workYou will lead the work on some of the most popular consumer brands in the world, impacting the daily lives of nearly 2 billion people in the fastest growing region in the world. You will work for clients who not only care about success in the marketplace, but are passionate about the role of brands in helping bring about social change.Expectations of an Associate Creative DirectorHelp lead and inspire creative teams to develop innovative design solutions, from broad concept development through implementationIdeate, write and execute original and iconic creative concepts in response to client briefs, objectives or goals.Is responsible for the proper placement, context and meaning of every image and graphic element within a creative assignment.Extend client relationships and explore new ways to deliver value.Develop creative ideas that meets both our clients‚Äô objectives as well as our business objectives, maintaining the company‚Äôs expected levels of creative excellence and professionalism.Present, share and review creative work with Executive Creative Director/s, Account Management and Planning Leads as well as members of the Management Team.Manage multiple projects from concept through to completion, working with both in-house resources and third-party vendors.Collaborate effectively with Account Management, Planning and the broader creative team to develop disruptive and iconic work.Manage multiple projects from concept through to completion, working with both in-house resources and third-party vendors.Participants in, and leads brainstorming sessions.You will report into a Creative Director-level and above.Expectations as a member of our communityYou believe passionately in the power of creativity to bring change to the world. But you‚Äôre realistic and have a clear-eyed view of what it will take to get there: not a path you walk alone, but with a group of people putting a diverse range of skills and perspectives to work, towards a common goal.Your ideas and your voice will be heard, respected and protected with passion. Ideas are not disposable commodities here, they are our most precious assets.You will be tested, you will be challenged and you will be pushed beyond your comfort zone, but you will equally be supported, encouraged and celebrated. Because the true value of a community is that we bring out the best in each other.Expectations as a team leaderYou will learn that we prefer not to hire our leaders, but to grow them. title: Creative Lead
description: About Doctor AnywhereDoctor Anywhere is a regional tech-enabled omni channel healthcare service company, headquartered in Singapore. With a strong network of established healthcare providers and experienced doctors, our digital platform and mobile app enable users to manage their health easily and effectively where they can consult a licensed local doctor anytime, anywhere, and get medication delivered to their doorsteps within hours.Under the DA Network clinics, users also have access to a panel of general practitioners, specialists, and allied healthcare providers. Complementing this ecosystem is the DA Marketplace where users can shop for a wide range of health and wellness products and services all in one place.We now serve more than one million, and growing users and our aim is to increase healthcare accessibility and provide affordable health care for everyone. Join us to help everyone lead happier and healthier lives!The role we are hiring forWe are seeking a driven and inquisitive Creative Lead with a strong interest in evolving digital trends and emerging technologies, and a keen eye for details.You will be in charge of defining the brand‚Äôs visual identity, and maintaining the key assets library and guidelines that the creative teams in each country will adhere to. On top of working closely with Marketing and the wider teams in conceptualising first-class visual communications and design across different channels, you will also provide guidance to the junior designers in the local teams to ensure that every piece of communication tells a powerful story while being clear, engaging, sophisticated, and in line with our brand guidelines and templates.The ideal candidate will have a mindset of continuous improvement and change and will demonstrate leadership, curiosity, collaboration and the ability to deal with ambiguity especially in a start-up environment.This role reports directly to the PR Comms  Content Marketing Manager, Singapore.A summary of the key responsibilities and requirements are as follows:Responsibilities  Develop a strong understanding of the DA brand, and define the brand‚Äôs key visual identity and best practices  Provide creative guidance to the designers in the local teams in terms of implementation  Working closely with the Marketing and wider teams to transform concepts into visual communications  Managing creative projects from initiation through completion  Designing and creating material for new business pitches and thought leadership projects (e.g. surveys and reports)  Recommending and brainstorming creative solutions  Designing and creating internal and external presentations in MS Powerpoint  Designing graphics for social media platforms, email templates, event invitations, signages and web content  Conceptualizing and developing forward thinking and creative marketing productsRequirements  A Degree in Graphic Design/Visual Arts/Marketing with minimally 5-8 years experience working in the design field  Proficient in the Adobe Creative Suite including InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator  Proven ability to create compelling visual communications using a range of design programs  Creative and forward thinking, with knowledge of current visual design trends  Ability to conceptualize, synthesize and illustrate key messages that incorporate different perspectives  Experienced in designing for a range of media including presentations, print, digital, etc.  Experience of working within a tech startup and hyper growth environment would be a bonus  A start-up attitude ‚Äì highly collaborative with an entrepreneurial, roll-up-your sleeves attitude, pragmatic, and able  to work independently when required  Comfortable with ambiguity - we're a fast-growing business and there's always unchartered territories, which is part of the fun. You should be comfortable with it and understand that not everything is 100% defined all the time.¬∑   Please include a portfolio of previous works in your application for reference.

title: Lead Software Engineer, Risk Data Mining
description: The BRIC team works to minimize the damage of inauthentic behaviors on ByteDance platforms (e.g. TikTok, CapCut, Resso, Lark), covering multiple classical and novel community and business risk areas such as account integrity, engagement authenticity, anti spam, API and growth health, live streaming security and financial safety (ads or e-commerce), etc. In this team you'll have a unique opportunity to have first-hand exposure to the strategy of the company in key security initiatives, especially in building scalable and robust, intelligent and privacy-safe, secure and product-friendly systems and solutions. Our challenges are not some regular day-to-day technical puzzles -- You'll be part of a team that's developing novel solutions to first-seen challenges of a non-stop evolvement of a phenomenal product eco-system. The work needs to be fast, transferrable, while still down to the ground to making quick and solid differences.Responsibilities- Enable and contribute to establishing fast and continuous threat response, in partnership with risk data scientists and product partners, by building advanced analytical tools and data insights.- Enable and contribute to establishing robust, powerful and privacy-aware automated defense, in partnership with risk data scientists and infrastructure and platform partners, by creating and improving risk control rules, machine learning models and product initiatives.- Enable and contribute to establishing scalable, reliable, generalizable and customizable risk detection and perception solutions that would be transferrable between products, markets and risk areas, which could help the future of risk data mining be more modulized, scalable beyond linear analytical head count. - Own technical measurement and improvement of risk level of a specific business area (e.g. TikTok, growth, live streaming, ads, e-commerce, Lark). Define and coordinate planning, execution and generalization of risk solutions. Drive and take responsibility for adversarial risk control campaigns. Support area stakeholders' ongoing risk control needs.Job Requirements- Bachelor or degrees above in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Statistics or other relevant majors (e.g. finance if applying for payment fraud positions). - Solid technical / data-mining skills and ability to work with large volume data to identify and abstract abusive behavior patterns in ByteDance products. Proficiency in Linux, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Storm.- 4+ years of strong industry experience in predictive analytics and/or statistical modelling. Successful tracking records in solving large scale data mining problems such as relevance, recommendation, anti-fraud and relevant financial problems. Strong coding (backend, infra, algorithm) skills and system design ability.- Strong technical leadership combined with hands-on data mining and machine learning skills and passion to work with ByteDance's data scale and business complexity. Be able to identify, plan and lead to execute both quick win tactics and long term strategies against abusers on our platforms.- Strong ownership, communication and collaboration skills to end-to-end own one or more critical platform/community security business fronts that are highly adversarial, ever expanding, and by nature widely cross functional.Preferred - Deep understanding about modern machine learning theory and applications, especially around popular neural nets (e.g. natural language processing, graph embedding), and/or relevant unsupervised/semisupervised/transfer learning. Hands-on industrial model development skills and strong data science sense/habit.

title: Quality & Training Executive
description: Who we areAmerican International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a leading global insurance organization. Use quality monitoring data management system to compile and track performance at team and individual level.  Lead enhancement of the Quality Monitoring Program to meet the needs of Contact Centre. Generate and analyze reporting to identify gaps and improvements.  Provides trend data to site management team.  Prepare and present necessary information on portfolio to provide visibility and identify opportunities.  Collaborate and work closely with Contact Centre management and other departments across the organisation to facilitate all areas of responsibility.  Support Project Management and Transformation teams as Subject Matter Expert on technology and operations implementations and operations and process initiatives and projects within the Contact Centre.What we‚Äôre looking for:  Diploma/Degree or relevant working experience.  Bilingual in English and Bahasa Melayu/Mandarin or Tamil.  Certificate in General Insurance preferred  Candidates with ACTA and other training and assessment certification, Process Management Professional Certification (Six Sigma, ISO Internal Auditor etc.) are encouraged to apply.  Proficient in use of Microsoft Office Suite  Familiarity with Contact Centre Management tools, metrics and technology platforms.  Background in General Insurance preferred  Strong Communication skills (written, verbal , active listening)  Time management and prioritization skills to be able to work independently manage workload and meet the required deadlines and targets.  Excellent Interpersonal skills and people management skills and ability to engage training attendees and stakeholders various levels of organisation.  Teamwork and collaboration  Strong problem solving and analytical skills.  Resilient, resourceful, displays strong initiative, self-directed and motivated.  Ability to coach for performance, Knowledge and experience in performance management methodologies a bonus.  In depth understanding of  customer service, experience and/or telemarketing  Detail orientedWe are an Equal Opportunity EmployerAmerican International Group, Inc., its subsidiaries and affiliates are committed to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and its‚Äô policies and procedures reflect this commitment. We provide equal opportunity to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, gender expression, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected categories such as sexual orientation. title: General Counsel
description: Nice to meet you! We are Ascenda.We‚Äôre a global fintech company based in Singapore, transforming how the world‚Äôs biggest financial brands engage their customers.The thrill of saving up rewards points for an exciting trip, or the joy of treating your loved one to a Michelin star dinner courtesy of a special offer ‚Äì these are the moments we live to make possible. This is why we are here.We make customer engagement simple for banks and payment networks globally. Previously, these companies had to endure complex patchworks of third-party loyalty systems, mediocre user experiences and 18-month implementation projects to deploy a competitive rewards program.We turn things upside down with solutions rooted in beautiful design, state-of-the-art SaaS technology and rapid implementation.Join Ascenda and help us make the financial services world a whole lot more exciting and rewarding than it has ever been.About the roleThis role requires the provision of high-quality advice to our business on a broad range of legal, commercial, contract and operational matters to help ensure the scale up, build, distribution and operations of the business comply with applicable laws and contractual commitments.This is your opportunity to be part of a thriving technology business by providing legal support to our growing business by ensuring comprehensive, end-to-end legal support by facilitating thoughtful risk-taking to enable Ascenda to deliver on strategy.In this role you will:‚óè Structure, draft, and negotiate various agreements, including complex software delivery and technology outsourcing agreements, with clients, strategic partners, suppliers and financial institutions.‚óè Partner with the product, technology, sales, partnerships, communications, and other teams to provide legal guidance related to business and the broader markets, ensuring comprehensive, end-to-end legal support by facilitating thoughtful risk-taking to enable Ascenda to deliver on its strategy.‚óè Advise stakeholders regarding relevant issues and risks related to our products/services and roadmap, and ensure our terms, documentation, and agreements reflect our internal corporate policies and processes.‚óè Support business teams in structuring transactions from a legal, regulatory, tax and compliance perspective.‚óè Coordinate and support special projects such as MA, fundraising, and advising on regulatory matters including market entry, licensing etc.‚óè Providing proactive and practical legal advice and support, and responding the demands of the business in relation to contract issues, disputes and best practices often within tight deadlines.‚óè Keep track of relevant regulatory circulars in relevant markets and promptly advise stakeholders of its implications on business operations and legal risks and assist with strategies to deal with the same.‚óè Deliver training and develop tools and guidance to help business colleagues make sense of the legal and regulatory world around them.‚óè Stay abreast of developments in critical legal areas: fintech, payments, financial services, consumer protection, privacy, etc.What we offer:‚óè World-class software technology organization‚óè Open, transparent and friendly culture‚óè Competitive salary and benefits‚óè Diverse team across numerous global locationsWhat We Are Looking For:‚óè 5+ years of legal experience in a law firm and/or corporate environment, preferably in a high-growth technology company.‚óè Minimum 3+ years of legal experience in fintech or payments company.‚óè Strong transactional experience negotiating client and supplier agreements in an international, cross-border context.‚óè Strong compliance experience, particularly in the fintech/payments related industry is essential.‚óè Experience with working on cross-border contracting and corporate agreements in various geographies.‚óè Experience creating and scaling legal processes, policies, and systems to help streamline, simplify, and automate them for a rapidly growing company.‚óè Sound and practical legal and business judgment with the ability to assess risks and clearly communicate those risks to business partners.‚óè Excellent written and verbal communication and negotiation skills (in English) with a highly responsive attitude and high attention to detail.‚óè Ability to organize, prioritize and manage deadlines in a fast-paced work environment.‚óè A solution-oriented mindset -- the ability and willingness to know what‚Äôs important and to collaborate to get it done.‚óè Self-starter who takes ownership and takes the initiative, sees what needs to be done and then does it.‚óè Passionate about regulatory matters, inquisitive, able to self-initiate learning and brainstorming.‚óè Rigorous work ethic and proven ability to work efficiently under pressure on multiple projects.‚óèBachelor‚Äôs degree plus a postgraduate education in law.

title: Mechanical Supervisor

Audits the QA/QC process and quality of reports/documentation  Supports the improvement and implementation of the site inspection and defect elimination strategy such as preventive maintenance and RBI  Provides technical support for NDT activitiesKNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED¬∑ Diploma in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent¬∑ 10 years‚Äô experience in Refinery and Petrochemical process technical environment Prior¬∑ Experience in inspection and QA/QC of Projects, Plant Commissioning, Asset Integrity, Turnarounds and Maintenance Execution is essential.¬∑ Understand Operations, Maintenance and engineering practices.¬∑ Understand common petrochemical standards such as ASME and API¬∑ Possess relevant ASNT/PCN and API certifications¬∑ Knowledge in CMMS systems¬∑ Good communication skills and internal / external stakeholder management

title: Senior CQ Engineer
description: Purpose of the Role:In this CQ Senior Engineer role, the individual will work directly with the CQ Manager to provide both technical oversight and guidance to the implementation of the project CQ program, and achievement of the project schedule, in designated equipment groups.Primary responsibility will be to lead a team with an additional CQ engineer, three operators, one mechanical and one EI support technician in the safe energisation and start-up of a designated equipment train. Each equipment train consists primarily of three head tanks, three reactors, one crystalliser, one filter dryer and one distillate receiver tank along with all associated ancillary equipment. This will be a hands on, field based execution role with responsibility for leading the CQ efforts and achievement of the required project quality and schedule requirements.This individual will be required to prepare and execute CQ documentation in accordance with the project CQ program and to take responsibility for training, replication, consistency and implementation of best practices. They will work closely with the CQ Manager to make sure the CQ schedule and program requirements are being met for their designated equipment group and any exceptions are identified and addressed.This role will report to the CQ Manager. The requested start date is January 2021 for an initial 18 month assignment.Role Responsibilities  Abide by all safety requirements and procedures and serve as a positive model to others in this regard. Re-enforce in meetings, perform periodic field observation and feedback as needed to ensure safe and compliant delivery of commissioning and qualification activities.  Provide technical oversight to assure technical work quality and consistent delivery of CQ in accordance with the project CQ program.  Provide a strong working technical knowledge of utility and process systems regarding the development of protocols, their execution, and close out.  Track and report progress to the CQ manager as required in support of the agreed CQ metrics.  Prepare and execute CQ documentation in accordance with the project CQ program.  Work collaboratively with the other project disciplines (e.g. automation, construction, engineering, end user) to support integration of activities.  Train site personnel and contract hires on the CQ program and provide oversight and guidance on the CQ deliverables.  Review and acceptance of contractor and vendor handover documentation for Mechanical Completion Acceptance.  Running control modules, equipment modules, phases etc. via a DCS system.  Vendor and contractor coordination and supervision.Role Requirements:  BS Engineering (or equivalent experience)  10 years CQ experience in pharmaceuticals or biologics, with 3 in a leadership role. This is a pharmaceutical plant and knowledge and experience of unit operations in pharmaceuticals is preferential.  In-depth equipment commissioning and startup knowledge and experience with strong troubleshooting skills.  Demonstrated leadership and people management skills.  GMP knowledge is required as Installation and Operational Qualification execution is included in the role. This is not, however, a validation role.  Working knowledge of DeltaV automation systems.  Travel: None

title: Executive Assistant/Office Manager
description: At Next Gen Foods, we believe a new era of food is coming. An era where we are actively thinking about how we eat, how our food impacts our health and the planet, and that is more delicious than ever before. We don‚Äôt want anyone to have to change what they eat; we just want to innovate how we produce and procure our favorite foods. And that‚Äôs where uniquely inventive food tech and the explosive power of plants comes in.That‚Äôs the ethos behind Next Gen Foods, and we‚Äôre going big with our very first brand: TiNDLE. Ridiculously good chicken made from plants. Launched in 2020 and already being savored around the globe, TiNDLE is a dining experience that will make you wonder why we ever needed birds to make chicken. On top of its unparalleled taste and texture, TiNDLE has the pan-cuisine versatility that chefs look for‚Äî which not a lot of big-name chicken producers can claim.TiNDLE is just the start of Next Gen Foods‚Äô mission of plant-based food innovation. We attribute our success to the expertise of our team, our unparalleled RD know-how, and our unwavering commitment to making food better without compromises. As we expand our global footprint, we are always looking to grow our team with best in class talent. That could be you! Read on.Job Summary:The Executive Assistant  Office Manager will manage the day-to-day business activities of the C-suite, including providing strategic management of the C-suite‚Äôs busy and complex schedule, coordinating meetings with internal and external contacts, preparing and tracking the C-suite‚Äôs expenses and arranging complex travel. The role is a pivotal support position, as the Executive Assistant is a key liaison among employees and between the C-suite and external partners, which include funders, senior policy makers and legislators.Key Responsibilities:Executive Support (60%)  Organize and coordinate the C-suites daily calendar‚Äîscheduling all appointments, coordinating logistics for speaking engagements and handling special event invitations on behalf of the C-suite.  Manage and arrange travel for C-suite.  Proactively consider needs related to calendar, travel and speaking engagements.  Track C-suite‚Äôs expenses and prepare expense reports for reimbursement and billing.  Write individualized correspondence and other documents as requested by the C-suite.  Support the C-suite as needed in preparing for speaking engagements or other internal or external meetings conducting research and other similar tasks.  Receive and triage incoming written communications to appropriate employees and facilitate response or action to be carried through by C-suite as needed.  Manage organizational communication, scheduling and logistics for key internal and external events such as board meetings and leadership meetings.  On behalf of C-suite, provide essential support to Board of Directors, including serving as key point of contact, coordinating meeting logistics, communications and materials.  As appropriate, provide administrative support to other Executive Team members in terms of managing meeting logistics, making travel arrangements and coordinating schedules  Coordination of corporate secretarial, resolutions, bank documents and signatories  Other administrative duties as needed.Office Management (25%)  Serve as the key point of contact for main office vendors, such as maintenance, mailing, supplies, equipment repair. Monitor office machines and systems, and problem-solve issues as needed (including postage meter, copiers, conference room scheduling).  Monitor and maintain inventory of necessary office supplies; order supplies as needed to keep basic supplies stocked, and to fulfill special requests from employees.  Design, communicate and oversee implementation of office operations, policies and procedures.  Maintain responsibility for general office upkeep and ‚Äúlook and feel.‚Äù This includes keeping kitchen and supply areas stocked, clean and functional.Other Support (15%).  Support other functional areas and members of the organization‚Äôs leadership team with special projects as needed.Key Requirements, Experience and Qualification  Strong commitment to the mission and goals of the organization.  Aware of and able to navigate diverse cultural backgrounds.  A minimum of five years‚Äô experience in an administrative support role, preferably at the senior level. Experience supporting Executives a must have.   Degree or equivalent experience.  A self-starter with a high degree of energy and careful attention to detail. Strong sense of initiative and a process-improvement mindset.  Highly flexible, creative problem solver, with a strong ability to multi-task.  Excellent oral and written communication skills.  Strong interpersonal skills.  Execute and exhibit good judgment. High level of professionalism.  Superb organizational and time-management skills.  Excellent computer skills; proficient or advanced skill in Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook)  A demonstrated ability to plan effectively, but the flexibility to handle the unexpected  High tolerance for ambiguity, changing work priorities and deadlines, and a willingness to take on responsibilities and to prioritize own work on multiple projectsWhat We Offer  A unique opportunity to join a dynamic start up environment led by a visionary management team.  Fast paced learning curve for willing learners.  Fun and energetic team.  Excellent career progression development opportunities in a company expected to scale rapidly.  Opportunities to influence and initiate strategic changes to the business.

title: Senior Energy Program Manager
description: Amazon is looking for a results-oriented Energy Program Manager to join the AWS APAC Energy Team. In this role, you will be managing several programs across power infrastructure delivery and sustainability projects. The candidate will also get opportunities to manage significant sustainability and decarbonization programs in APAC which would also require working with teams across several Amazon businesses to help deliver our Climate Pledge goals. The ideal candidate for this role will lead cross-functional and technical teams to develop process and business metrics by using a host of internal Amazon tools in delivering our power infrastructure on time, reliably and cost effectively. Along the way, the candidate will use his/her judgment, negotiation skills, analytical talent, technical aptitude, and leadership to collaborate with a diverse set of stakeholders and build new processes and metrics.The  successful candidate will be a strong communicator (both written and verbal), not be hindered by ambiguity or competing priorities. They will be able to apply a variety of project management tools, methodologies and techniques for all phases of the project lifecycle. title: Regional Risk Engineer
description: What's it like?The Utility/Tech Lines Risk Engineer will receive multiple risk engineering requests from the in-country based underwriters, all at the same time and with similar levels of urgency. The engineer will need to prioritize the demand accordingly and manage expectations  He/She will write significant number of Market Reports and be pressured to deliver within unrealistic timelines. The engineer will need to prioritize the demand accordingly and manage expectations  They will also have to be able to travel frequently to remote parts of Asia, including long road travels, anywhere from two to six/seven hours each leg, under demanding local environments, often in less than stellar conditions  He/She must love being out in the hot and humid power plant environment  They will need to be flexible in their dietary requirements as one will often only have access to local diets in the respective countries within Asia  He/She must enjoy developing and maintaining relationships with brokers, their engineers as well as fellow Insurance industry professionalsResponsibilities:  Provide Underwriter supportIn assisting with the process of risk selection and the evaluation of loss potential quantum.To provide such risk evaluations as to allow Underwriters to better understand the nature and extent of the risks that are underwritten.  Provide a differentiator from competitors by adding competent Risk Management services.  Provide brokers and clients with factual and balanced external reports assessing both positive and negative aspects of risks including recommendations, if any, on risk improvements.  Analyse loss experiences and provide feedback to Claims Managers, Loss Adjustors and Underwriters, including recommendations to minimise loss quantum and also to reduce future loss exposures.  Provide current and technical information to Underwriters as required.  Foster and build strong, long-term relationships with Brokers and Clients.Requirements:  Min 10 years heavy industries work experience prior to insurance industry  Half of those in Power Generation  Either in Operations, Maintenance, Commissioning or combinations thereof  Insurance industry risk management experience may be advantageousTechnical Knowledge required:  Industrial/power plant construction knowledge  Understanding of Power Generation systems and processes  Intimate knowledge of power generation technologies  Ability to understand concepts outside core area of learningBehavioural Attributes:  Excellent interpersonal skills  Excellent verbal and written skills in English  Competent at managing tough clients professionally  Ability to handle long hours in demanding environmentsEducation:  Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Mechanical/Electrical/Control  Instrumentation Engineering

title: Strategic Account Manager
description: Strategic Account ManagerToku‚Äôs mission is to help companies engage with their customers efficiently. We have helped companies move all the voice communications to the cloud and recently embarked on creating products that help companies keep engaging with their customers no matter where their employees are working from.Toku is currently getting into a scale-up mode. We want to continue creating momentum for our products in the APAC regions and helping customers with their communications needs. As we build the Enterprise Sales foundation, we are looking for an experienced Strategic Account Manager who can drive both customer satisfaction and commercial growth across an assigned portfolio of premium accounts. Want to be part of our journey?What would you be doing?You will report to our Head of Enterprise Sales. You will act as a key point of contact between Toku and its strategic clients. This role will work with key customers to identify their wants and prepares reports by collecting, analysing, and summarising sales information. Including discussion and giving recommendations on how specific products or services can meet their Business/Technical needs. maintaining customer relationships to strategically place new products and drive sales for long-term growth.  Own the full lifecycle for strategic projects from requirements gathering, budgeting, and planning through to execution, delivery, and monitoring.  Identifying and winning new high value and strategic enterprise customers to achieve financial targets.  To establish a sales portfolio plan that set-out the strategy to achieve your key performance metrics and build a sustainable pipeline over the next 6-12 months.  To establish and maintain long term relationships with ‚ÄúC‚Äù‚Äô level decision makers to maximize business opportunities.  To develop and maintain in depth knowledge of your client business and technology environment and drivers.  Be responsible for the successful delivery and business outcomes of both internal and client-facing projects, of which there may be several in parallel.  Develop  own the risk management framework for each project.  On a weekly basis, report progress, opportunities, and risk to senior management.We would love to hear from you if you have:  Have 8-10 years‚Äô experience managing high-impact IT and business projects involving both internal and external stakeholders.  Well-developed problem-solving skills  Strong grasp of commercial principles and contract negotiations with clients.  8~10 years relevant sale and business development experience in the Cloud Communication market ‚Äì CCaaS, UCaaS, CPaaS.  Ability to articulate the value of a complex enterprise sale in business terms, outlining the value proposition, ROI and total cost of ownership.  Demonstrate ability to exceed financial targets and to generate new business with customers.  Possess a broad knowledge base across technical, operational, and financial business functions, understanding how the pieces fit together for a scaling company.  Be an excellent communicator, proactive and highly organized.  Be experienced in telecommunications and/or B2B SaaS in Cloud Communication space.What would you get?  Flexible working locations  Training and Development  Discretionary Yearly Bonus  Salary Review  Healthcare Coverage based on location  20 days Paid Annual Leave (excluding Bank holidays)If you would love to experience working in a start-up growing at an accelerated speed, and you think you tick most of the requirements, join us!This position is only open to Singaporeans.

description: The Regional Internal Control Manager, will oversee rolling-out the existing Internal Control Framework at DFS in conjunction with the Group Risk Management  Control (RMC) department.His/her main objectives are to: ‚ñ™ Elevate and animate the general control environment at Divisional level by ensuring internal controls are adequate and fit-for purpose‚ñ™ Provide assurance to stakeholders that controls are operating effectively and compliant with Group and Divisional SOP's. title: Senior Projects Executive
description: We are looking for an early career professional who is savvy, creative and well-versed in feminism and social justice topics. For 2022, you will help coordinate AWARE‚Äôs upcoming Growing Up Indian project, and a research project on domestic violence.Project coordination  Timely coordination of AWARE‚Äôs Growing Up Indian (GUI) project, including assistance with budgeting, funding applications, coordination of honorariums  Liaising with contributors, volunteers, communications and fundraising staff, designers, printers, and other partners  Co-writing the introduction to the GUI anthology, editing and proofreading submissions  Organising public engagement events to publicise the launch of GUI, community workshops on oral histories, intercultural understanding, and effective writingAdvocacy and Research  Project coordination of AWARE‚Äôs primary research projects (including assistance with budgeting, funding applications, recruitment and training of personnel, coordination of payments etc.)  Research support for AWARE‚Äôs primary research projects, including conducting literature review, assistance with drafting interview and focus group discussion interview guides, conducting interviews and focus group discussions, data analysis, and writing of research reports)  Drafting occasional forum letters on primary research topics (e.g forum letters) on AWARE‚Äôs core advocacy areas  Developing and executing AWARE‚Äôs public advocacy campaigns to accompany the publication of new research  Helping the ARC department to conceptualise, organise and promote events (both online and, in the long term, offline)  Other miscellaneous administrative tasksPreferred Candidate Profile  At least two years of related work experience in project coordination, conducting primary and secondary research  A diploma/degree in political science, sociology, gender studies, media and communications, or title: Lead Data Scientist, Risk Data Mining
description: The BRIC team works to minimize the damage of inauthentic behaviors on ByteDance platforms (e.g. TikTok, CapCut, Resso, Lark), covering multiple classical and novel community and business risk areas such as account integrity, engagement authenticity, anti spam, API abuse, growth fraud, live streaming security and financial safety (ads or e-commerce), etc. In this team you'll have a unique opportunity to have first-hand exposure to the strategy of the company in key security initiatives, especially in building scalable and robust, intelligent and privacy-safe, secure and product-friendly systems and solutions. Our challenges are not some regular day-to-day technical puzzles -- You'll be part of a team that's developing novel solutions to first-seen challenges of a non-stop evolvement of a phenomenal product eco-system. The work needs to be fast, transferrable, while still down to the ground to making quick and solid differences.Responsibilities- Enable and contribute to establishing fast and continuous threat response, in partnership with risk data mining engineers and product partners, by building advanced analytical tools and derive data insights.- Analyze security and product data to uncover latest attacker techniques and abuse vectors. Generalize them into data mining opportunities in product features; modeling signals, labels and algorithms; measurement and process effectiveness.- Enable and contribute to establishing robust, powerful and privacy-aware automated defense, in partnership with risk data mining engineers, by leveraging risk systems, machine learning tools and business resources to build and improve risk control rules, models and products.- Abstract and build risk measurements that best connect risk research, risk operation, risk defense and business/community health with data stories, drive strategic and tactical risk control roadmaps with such metrics collaboratively with product/business/engineering stakeholders.- Uphold adversarial threat response in a specific business area (e.g. TikTok, growth, live streaming, ads, e-commerce, Lark) to be consistently prompt, rigorous and clean. Define and uphold data science practice excellence and metric-driven decision making process. Bridge technical and communicational gaps between engineering, product and business teams.Requirements- Bachelor, master or PhD degree in an advanced field of technology or management or other equivalent majors. E.g. Computer science, statistics, internet security, finance.- Proficiency in data analysis and statistical analysis tools such as SQL, R and Python.- 4+ years of strong industry experience in predictive analytics and/or statistical modelling. Successful tracking records in solving large scale data mining problems such as relevance, recommendation, anti-fraud and relevant financial problems.- Strong technical leadership combined with hands-on data mining and machine learning application experience, and passion to work with ByteDance's data scale and business complexity. Be able to identify, plan and lead to execute both quick win tactics and long term strategies against abusers on our platforms.- Strong ownership, communication and collaboration skills to end-to-end own one or more critical platform/community security business fronts that are highly adversarial, ever expanding, and by nature widely cross functional.Preferred- Experience in risk analytics in multiple areas: account take over, fraud, spam, abuse and etc. OR strong experience in data/statistical analysis on general internet or financial business. OR deep understanding about modern Machine Learning theory, applications, industry best practice.- Consistency at exercising data science best practice in modern internet industry or academic world. Persistence in reasoning with data, interpreting data objectively, and making data-driven decisions.

title: Citi Private Bank, Know Your Customer Quality Assurance Ops Specialists
description: The Citi Private Bank Client Know Your Customer Quality Assurance Ops Specialists is a developing professional role in Know Your Customer (KYC), Anti-Money Laundering (AML), Account Opening  Documentation Review, responsible to support the client onboarding of Citi Private Bank clients. Observe and highlight complex and variable issues with significant departmental impact in the team.  Establishes risk management practice, ensures a strong and robust processing environment with effective controls.  Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. title: SAP FICO Solution Architect / Manager
description: This is a delivery-focused role in an implementation project, managing complex delivery. Candidate must have implementation experience and be able to support Global Business Solution implementations by effective management of global end to end business processes including process re-engineering and process flow analysis.Pre-Requisites:  Must have strong FICO working experience with all business partners and manage relationships  Able to configure and end to end activities of integrated global business solution implementations  Has management of assigned business solution projects including integrating plans with plans of other business partners under consulting backgroundResponsibilities:  You will be part of full project lifecycle experience including design, data, functional specs, configuration, testing and post go live support experience  Assess and recommend solutions according to scope and to resolve open design issues  Identifies, assesses and solves complex business problems for area of responsibility, where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors  Configuration of SAP FICO to support scope; document configuration rationale  Develop Functional Specs for all relevant developments to support all SAP processes  Develop / Update relevant Master Data Standards especially master data to support SAP FICO processes  Maintain clear and organized documentation of all work and assist with the user training and support where necessary.  Plan, Manage and Lead the testing efforts and drive business partners to complete testing and approve solution  Address, respond and resolve all service requests in most efficient and timely manner.  Engage with business users and stakeholders to gauge business requirements and provide inputs from IT perspective.  Regularly update business partners with progress of the work if issues cannot be resolved in expected time.  Monitor and maintain system activities with focus on interfaces, batch jobs, short dumps, connectivity to internal and external systems.  Guide and respond to business users of system use, business processes, testing and other system related inquiries.  Plan milestone and deadline and provide progress update to various stakeholders and escalate in advance if timelines cannot be met with.  Execution of allotted responsibilities in special projects and adhere to various deadlines of the projects.  You will also be involved in project implementation methodologies  ITIL processes.Requirements:  Must have more than 10 working years in SAP environment; must have more than 3-4 years in consulting industry.  Involved in at least 3-4 end to end cycle of SAP FICO in system configuration and implementation projects in consulting environment  Strong experience in development of custom reports and enhancements.  Strong organizational/planning skills with the ability to prioritize and work effectively in a fast-paced environment, proficiency in multi-tasking  Have supporting testing and data migration experience, as well as drafting of functional specification for reports, interface, enhancement, forms  Able to start in a short notice periodPersonal Attributes:  You must possess a personal attribute such as creativity, positive thinking, quick-witted, imagination, leadership, judgment and maturity, curiosity, strong interpersonal skills, professional integrity and initiative.  It would be great if you have excellent analytical, presentation and soft skills including communication; write clearly and concisely in prepare training materials  Confident in communicating and presenting at business level to MNC clients.

title: Senior Systems Architect
description: Meet Our Team: As a key member of the Pega APAC System Architecture team, you will work with a passionate and driven project team, delivering new and innovative business and technical solutions using Pega technology. Picture Yourself at Pega: Pega is changing the way the world builds software. In this role, you‚Äôll help us design, develop, implement and test the next generation of Pega‚Äôs products. This is your chance to get your hands-on leading technology that figures out what people really care about. What You'll Do at Pega:   Partner with our world leading clients to deliver high quality technical solutions across all phases of the software development lifecycle   Utilise your outstanding technical consulting skills to demonstrate new and innovative ways to implement software solutions   Mentor and train our clients in Pega technology   Leveraging your Thought Leadership skills, you‚Äôll engage, educate and enable your clients‚Äô resources on Industry and Pega Best Practices.   Collaborating with a high performing Pega delivery team you will ensure the solution meets or exceeds your client‚Äôs expectations.  Who You Are:   You are a highly technical hands on Snr Developer/Engineer/Systems Architect who is passionate about exploring and applying Pega technology to help solve business problems   5‚Äì10 years of software development experience   Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or similar field   Agile/Scrum development methodology knowledge/experience  Exposure to a variety of technologies, including, but not limited to, WebSphere or Weblogic, J2EE (JSP, Servlets, EJB, XML, Java), .Net, Oracle, DB2, and MS/SQL.   Demonstrated knowledge of and applicability of Object-Oriented techniques and principles What You've Accomplished:   You‚Äôve built and implemented model-driven, enterprise-level business solutions and applications   You have been exposed to a variety of technologies including object-oriented design principles, database design, application and web servers   Strong track record of customer engagement and delivery success   3-5+ years of experience working with industry leading technologies to deliver your solution designs and vision in a fast-paced environment   Considered a trusted advisor and thought leader by your clients Pega Offers You:   Gartner Analyst acclaimed technology leadership across our categories of products   Continuous learning and development opportunities   An innovative, inclusive, agile, flexible, and fun work environment  Competitive global benefits program inclusive of pay + bonus incentive, Paid family medical, employee equity in the company
